result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M Gryniewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court will allow for discharge after 12 months if programming is completed.
**Honorable Janet C. Protasiewicz-Amended to JOC signed.  Probation discharged effective 6/11/2016.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant Thomas M Gryniewicz in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed. Court grants early discharge from probation on 6/11/2016 as long as all fines are paid in full.

Defendant Thomas M Gryniewicz in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas M Gryniewicz in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Micha Schwab, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:    Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Court will allow for discharge after 12 months is programming is completed.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
5 character letters received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defense is trying to get a deferred prosecution agreement and would like a short adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Danielle G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Thomas M Gryniewicz in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
